<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/as-countries-institute-travel-bans-for-omicron-a-debate-rages-over-their-effectiveness?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Debate Over Travel Bans
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/as-countries-institute-travel-bans-for-omicron-a-debate-rages-over-their-effectiveness?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A collage with a plane and a torn boarding pass" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/014f2ccafcf37c9b62095f74aec7ce10586682e6-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dianna "Mick" McDougall; Getty Images/fStop Images - Stephan Zirwes, imagestock, VanReeel, japatino, nanami_o</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As more cases of the new, highly mutated Covid variant Omicron pop up around the globe—including the US—countries are introducing more travel restrictions in an attempt to slow the virus’s spread.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The CDC said on Tuesday it might <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-cdc-urges-americans-avoid-travel-niger-poland-over-covid-19-2021-11-30/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">require</a> all air travelers coming into the US to show a negative Covid test within one day of departure (the current window for vaccinated international travelers to provide a negative test is three days). The Biden administration is also weighing whether to require people entering the country to self-quarantine for seven days, regardless of their test result.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The US, along with many other governments, has already blocked all foreign travel from eight countries in southern Africa, where Omicron was first detected.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Several nations, like Israel and Japan, have barred </span><span><em>all</em></span><span> foreign visitors.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There’s been loads of pushback</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While some governments say travel bans are an important tool to buy more time and gather more data on Omicron, the WHO is <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2021/12/01/covid-omicron-variant-live-updates/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew#link-L542JOFMVRC4FL6HNNQTWTQBMQ" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">calling BS</a>. Health officials there argue that blanket travel bans are ineffective at controlling the spread of Omicron and unfairly punish the nations targeted. Plus, the new variant was already spreading in Europe before it was detected in southern Africa, so...the glitter’s already been spilled.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What does the science say? </strong>There’s <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/11/28/1059619823/omicron-travel-bans-covid?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not much data</a> on the effectiveness of travel bans during Covid. One study showed that blanket travel bans early in the pandemic did slow down the spread of the virus. Another study didn’t find much evidence to support that.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Researchers are more certain that <em>other </em>types of travel policies that the US is considering, such as post-arrival testing and self-quarantining, can help curb transmission.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Pity the airline executive. Covid is already projected to cost the tourism sector $1.6 trillion this year, and the latest Omicron developments could put another dent in the travel industry’s rebound.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/mlb-enters-first-lockout-in-a-quarter-of-a-century?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
MLB's Owners to Players
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/mlb-enters-first-lockout-in-a-quarter-of-a-century?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Clip from the Sandlot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=386 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-12-01/image-aba8115bf30946ff48d6c3d5029494ba13e49dfb-480x276-gif/sandlot.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Clip from the Sandlot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-12-01/image-aba8115bf30946ff48d6c3d5029494ba13e49dfb-480x276-gif/sandlot.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>The Sandlot </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just when you thought baseball couldn’t get any slower, it went and stopped altogether.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">MLB’s 5-year collective bargaining agreement with its players <a href="https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/32754352/everything-need-know-mlb-looming-lockout?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expired</a> at 11:59pm ET last night, meaning the league has now entered a lockout that halts all operations—no free-agent signings, no trades, no use of facilities by players, and no contact between players and teams. It’s the first MLB work stoppage in 27 years and the ninth in league history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think of a lockout as an anti-strike. It’s when management (in this case, MLB owners) tells employees “you can’t come to work even if you want to” in a bid to speed up negotiations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How did we get here? </strong>It’s a classic labor dispute over how to distribute the spoils of a $10 billion league. The players’ union wants some things (better pay for younger players in their prime, for one), and the owners want other things (an expanded postseason, a salary floor).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the big worry is that the lockout will bleed into the season, which starts three months from now. But experts think the two sides will reach a new agreement by then.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/spotify-wrapped-but-for-the-entire-world?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Spotify Confirms This Year Was Weird
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While most of us spent yesterday wondering how Bo Burnham cracked our Spotify Wrapped top five and what a “wistful” audio aura means, the music streaming service also <a href="https://newsroom.spotify.com/2021-12-01/what-the-world-streamed-most-in-2021/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> its retrospective on the year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Top artist:</strong> Puerto Rican hit-maker Bad Bunny was the most streamed artist globally for the second year in a row, but this year he did it without even releasing a new album. Taylor Swift, BTS, Drake, and Justin Bieber rounded out the top five.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Top album:</strong> As a planet we were all really going through it because Olivia Rodrigo’s <em>Sour</em> was the most-streamed album.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Top song:</strong> “drivers license” by Olivia Rodrigo. Obviously.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Top podcast: </strong>Last year, Spotify <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/spotifys-exclusive-agreement-joe-rogan-begins-september-1?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nabbed</a> the exclusive rights to <em>The Joe Rogan Experience</em> in a $100 million deal, and this year it was the company's most popular podcast.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Rogan was followed by </span><span><em>Call Her Daddy,</em></span><span> which Spotify brought to its platform for $60+ million in June. </span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sign of the times:</strong> Streams of the playlist “Music for Plants” have grown 1,400% during the pandemic. And of course, there were over 42 million streams of vaccine-related playlists this year.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Tel Aviv is the world’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-01/cost-of-living-tel-aviv-paris-singapore-are-world-s-most-expensive-cities?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most expensive city</a> to live in, jumping from fifth place last year, per the Economist Intelligence Unit. It’s followed by Paris and Singapore (tied for second), Zurich, Hong Kong, New York, Geneva, Copenhagen, Los Angeles, and Osaka. Syria’s capital, Damascus, is the world’s cheapest city.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“While we now know where Peng is, I have serious doubts that she is free, safe, and not subject to censorship, coercion, and intimidation.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Steve Simon, chairman and CEO of the Women’s Tennis Association, said the tour is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/01/sports/tennis/wta-china-peng-shuai.html?referringSource=articleShare" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspending</a> all tournaments in China in response to the treatment of tennis star Peng Shuai, who accused a high-ranking Communist Party official of sexual assault and subsequently disappeared from public view for more than two weeks. The WTA’s retaliatory move represents a major departure from other US-based sports leagues, which mostly try to play nice with China.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>When multilevel marketing met Gen Z. (<a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2021/11/breakaway-movement-gen-z-multilevel-marketing/620592/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a>)</p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/particle-will-cut-a-banksy-into-10-000-nfts?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Shredding a Banksy Is So 2018
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/particle-will-cut-a-banksy-into-10-000-nfts?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Banksy's " Love is in the Air" painting" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f28c121f3b2032e968082810226dbc1d238a1683-5393x3595.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Yuki Iwamura/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Instead, the startup Particle is <a href="https://www.axios.com/art-world-banksy-nft-87666868-5041-4d07-abc2-a8d7703fb614.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cutting one up</a> into 10,000 NFTs. It announced yesterday that its first digitally sliced piece will be Banksy’s “Love is in the Air,” which it’s displaying at Art Basel this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s how you divide a priceless work of art into blockchain-backed ownership shares:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Buy the art: </strong>In May, Particle cofounder and former Christie’s co-chair Loïc Gouzer purchased the Banksy work for $12.9 million (far above its $3–$5 million estimate) in a move likely meant to build hype.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. Destroy the art:</strong> Particle plans to “legally destroy” the work by donating it to an eponymous nonprofit it’s established. That’s meant to strip the canvas of its value because “value can’t exist in two places,” Particle’s managing director told Axios. The alternative is burning it...which is exactly <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-56335948?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what was done</a> to another Banksy in March.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. Sell the NFTs:</strong> 10,000 “Particles” will go up for sale in early January. Buyers will receive a digital collector’s card, permission to view the painting IRL, and “the right to call the painting theirs.” Notably, Particle will earn royalties from any resale action.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>In NFT land, social media hype = value. Particle’s success will depend on rallying an online community similar to Bored Ape Yacht Club’s or ConstitutionDAO’s. Some choice memes wouldn’t hurt.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than a “Happy Holidays!” from your dentist’s office. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

They help </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/01/technology/misinformation-cute-cats-online.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spread</a></span><span> misinformation</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Sperm is being used to </span><span><a href="https://www.euronews.com/green/2021/11/29/sperm-is-being-used-to-create-an-eco-friendly-alternative-to-plastic?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">create</a></span><span> an eco-friendly alternative to plastic</span>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTRAVEL\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/as-countries-institute-travel-bans-for-omicron-a-debate-rages-over-their-effectiveness?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Debate Over Travel Bans\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/01/as-countries-institute-travel-bans-for-omicron-a-debate-rages-over-their-effectiveness?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A collage with a plane and a torn boarding pass\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/014f2ccafcf37c9b62095f74aec7ce10586682e6-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDianna \"Mick\" McDougall; Getty Images/fStop Images - Stephan Zirwes, imagestock, VanReeel, japatino, nanami_o\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs more cases of the new, highly mutated Covid variant Omicron pop up around the globe—including the US—countries are introducing more travel restrictions in an attempt to slow the virus’s spread.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe CDC said on Tuesday it might \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-cdc-urges-americans-avoid-travel-niger-poland-over-covid-19-2021-11-30/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequire\u003c/a\u003e all air travelers coming into the US to show a negative Covid test within one day of departure (the current window for vaccinated international travelers to provide a negative test is three days). The Biden administration is also weighing whether to require people entering the country to self-quarantine for seven days, regardless of their test result.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe US, along with many other governments, has already blocked all foreign travel from eight countries in southern Africa, where Omicron was first detected.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSeveral nations, like Israel and Japan, have barred \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eall\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e foreign visitors.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere’s been loads of pushback\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile some governments say travel bans are an important tool to buy more time and gather more data on Omicron, the WHO is \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2021/12/01/covid-omicron-variant-live-updates/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew#link-L542JOFMVRC4FL6HNNQTWTQBMQ\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalling BS\u003c/a\u003e. Health officials there argue that blanket travel bans are ineffective at controlling the spread of Omicron and unfairly punish the nations targeted. Plus, the new variant was already spreading in Europe before it was detected in southern Africa, so...the glitter’s already been spilled.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat does the science say? \u003c/strong\u003eThere’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/11/28/1059619823/omicron-travel-bans-covid?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot much data\u003c/a\u003e on the effectiveness of travel bans during Covid. One study showed that blanket travel bans early in the pandemic did slow down the spread of the virus. Another study didn’t find much evidence to support that.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eResearchers are more certain that \u003cem\u003eother \u003c/em\u003etypes of travel policies that the US is considering, such as post-arrival testing and self-quarantining, can help curb transmission.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003ePity the airline executive. Covid is already projected to cost the tourism sector $1.6 trillion this year, and the latest Omicron developments could put another dent in the travel industry’s rebound.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust when you thought baseball couldn’t get any slower, it went and stopped altogether.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMLB’s 5-year collective bargaining agreement with its players \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/32754352/everything-need-know-mlb-looming-lockout?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpired\u003c/a\u003e at 11:59pm ET last night, meaning the league has now entered a lockout that halts all operations—no free-agent signings, no trades, no use of facilities by players, and no contact between players and teams. It’s the first MLB work stoppage in 27 years and the ninth in league history.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThink of a lockout as an anti-strike. It’s when management (in this case, MLB owners) tells employees “you can’t come to work even if you want to” in a bid to speed up negotiations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow did we get here? \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s a classic labor dispute over how to distribute the spoils of a $10 billion league. The players’ union wants some things (better pay for younger players in their prime, for one), and the owners want other things (an expanded postseason, a salary floor).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe big worry is that the lockout will bleed into the season, which starts three months from now. But experts think the two sides will reach a new agreement by then.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e its retrospective on the year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTop artist:\u003c/strong\u003e Puerto Rican hit-maker Bad Bunny was the most streamed artist globally for the second year in a row, but this year he did it without even releasing a new album. Taylor Swift, BTS, Drake, and Justin Bieber rounded out the top five.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTop album:\u003c/strong\u003e As a planet we were all really going through it because Olivia Rodrigo’s \u003cem\u003eSour\u003c/em\u003e was the most-streamed album.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTop song:\u003c/strong\u003e “drivers license” by Olivia Rodrigo. Obviously.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTop podcast: \u003c/strong\u003eLast year, Spotify \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/31/spotifys-exclusive-agreement-joe-rogan-begins-september-1?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enabbed\u003c/a\u003e the exclusive rights to \u003cem\u003eThe Joe Rogan Experience\u003c/em\u003e in a $100 million deal, and this year it was the company's most popular podcast.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRogan was followed by \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eCall Her Daddy,\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e which Spotify brought to its platform for $60+ million in June. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSign of the times:\u003c/strong\u003e Streams of the playlist “Music for Plants” have grown 1,400% during the pandemic. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInstead, the startup Particle is \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/art-world-banksy-nft-87666868-5041-4d07-abc2-a8d7703fb614.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecutting one up\u003c/a\u003e into 10,000 NFTs. It announced yesterday that its first digitally sliced piece will be Banksy’s “Love is in the Air,” which it’s displaying at Art Basel this week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere’s how you divide a priceless work of art into blockchain-backed ownership shares:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. Buy the art: \u003c/strong\u003eIn May, Particle cofounder and former Christie’s co-chair Loïc Gouzer purchased the Banksy work for $12.9 million (far above its $3–$5 million estimate) in a move likely meant to build hype.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. Destroy the art:\u003c/strong\u003e Particle plans to “legally destroy” the work by donating it to an eponymous nonprofit it’s established. That’s meant to strip the canvas of its value because “value can’t exist in two places,” Particle’s managing director told Axios. The alternative is burning it...which is exactly \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-56335948?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhat was done\u003c/a\u003e to another Banksy in March.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. Sell the NFTs:\u003c/strong\u003e 10,000 “Particles” will go up for sale in early January. Buyers will receive a digital collector’s card, permission to view the painting IRL, and “the right to call the painting theirs.” Notably, Particle will earn royalties from any resale action.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIn NFT land, social media hype = value. Particle’s success will depend on rallying an online community similar to Bored Ape Yacht Club’s or ConstitutionDAO’s.
